sentences.en: A crime or scandal brings much notoriety to those involved in it.
sentences.cn: 罪行或丑闻常使有牵连的人声名狼藉.

sentences.en: And others will gain notoriety for how fiercely wild their machinery is.
sentences.cn: 他人则因为他们的机器多么地桀骜不羁而获得恶名.

sentences.en: At first he was bashful about the notoriety which the newspaper caused.
sentences.cn: 最初他对报纸给他引起的狼藉名声感到很害羞.

sentences.en: But its notoriety has made it a target.
sentences.cn: 但它的恶名也使其成为众矢之的.

sentences.en: Carpenter : Peglegs made here can be given to pirates, boosting their notoriety.
sentences.cn: 把这里制造的假腿给你的海盗船长, 能增加他们的名声.

sentences.en: He achieved notoriety as chief counsel to President Nixon in the Watergate break-in.
sentences.cn: 他因在水门事件中担任尼克松总统的首席法律顾问而声名狼藉。

sentences.en: His abrasive manner has won him an unenviable notoriety.
sentences.cn: 他生硬粗暴的态度让他声名狼藉。

sentences.en: His crimes earned him considerable notoriety.
His daring escape from prison gained him a certain notoriety.
sentences.cn: 他大胆的越狱使他臭名昭著.

sentences.en: His notoriety a rake did not come until his death.
sentences.cn: 他作为流氓的恶名是他死后才传开的.

sentences.en: His notoriety as a hooligan did not come until his death.
sentences.cn: 他作为流氓的恶名是在死后才传开的.

sentences.en: His notoriety as a rake did not come until his death.
sentences.cn: 他作为流氓的恶名是他死后才传开来的.

sentences.en: It has gained widespread notoriety in New Age circles.
sentences.cn: 这在新世纪圈子中都已广泛流传.

sentences.en: The line between popular and professional notoriety is not distinct.
sentences.cn: 公众领域与职业领域内的声名狼藉两者之间的界线并不分明.

sentences.en: You'll notice the effects of the notoriety system behind the scenes.
sentences.cn: 一直默默作业的恶名系统所产生的各种影响会让你注意到它的存在.
